com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class AuditRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianObjectRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.AuditRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SiperianObjectUidProvider, SystemProvider, Serializable

    public class AuditRequest
extends SiperianObjectRequest
implements SystemProvider
    Represents a request object to add additional log entries to the MDM Hub audit trail. The log entries are stored in the C_REPOS_AUDIT table.

    Use AuditRequest to log additional information about the activities related to an event or data in the MDM Hub. For example, you can audit an operation that updates a complex object before the object transforms and decomposes into MDM Hub objects.

    Example Audit Entries

    ROWID_AUDIT SVR1.179 SVR1.17A
    COMPONENT sif.api sif.api
    ACTION ListSiperianObjects ListSiperianObjects.RESPONSE
    STATUS info info
    FILLIN AAA BBB
    ROWID_OBJECT    
    DATA_XML    
    CONTEXT_XML    
    ROWID_AUDIT_PREVIOUS   SVR1.179
    INTERACTION_ID    
    USERNAME admin admin
    FROM_SYSTEM   Admin
    TO_SYSTEM Admin  
    TABLE_NAME    
    CONTEXT    

    Usage Example

    // Sample Code
    // Use AuditRequest in a servlet that receives an XML file to update multiple packages

    AuditRequest request = new AuditRequest();
    request.setComponent("mycompany.customerServlet");
    request.setAction("POST");
    request.setStatus("info");

    // Source and target systems for the request
    request.setFromSystem("CRM");
    request.setToSystem("Admin");

    // Metadata to understand the log entry
    request.setContext( dataId );

    // Absolute path and file name to the context XML file
    request.setContextXML("<metadata>"
    + "<url>" + httpServletRequest. getRequestURI() + "</url>"
    + "</metadata>");

    // Name and type of the package or base object
    request.setSiperianObjectUid(
    SiperianObjectType.PACKAGE.makeUid("CUSTOMER_UPDATE") );

    // Absolute path and file name to the data XML file
    request.setDataXML( requestXmlAsString );

    // Reference to the ROWID_AUDIT of the related previous audit record
    request.setRowidAuditPrevious(prevAuditResponse.getRowidAudit());

    // ROWID_OBJECT of the related data record if it is known
    request.setRowidObject("");

    AuditResponse response = (AuditResponse)
    sipClient.process(request);

    //Decompose the request data and call other SIF requests.

    See Also:
    AuditResponse, Serialized Form

    API Pair: AuditResponse

    API Group: Miscellaneous

      • getContext

        public String getContext()
        Gets the metadata of the event or data for audits that are invoked through SIF requests. Returns null for audit requests from the MDM Hub.
        Returns:
        Metadata of the event or data.

      • setContext

        public void setContext(String context)
        Sets the metadata, such as pkeySource, for audits that are invoked through SIF requests. Sets null for audit requests from the MDM Hub.
        Parameters:
        context - Metadata for the event or data.

      • getFromSystem

        public String getFromSystem()
        Gets the name of the source system. Returns Admin for message queues.
        Returns:
        Name of the source system.

      • setFromSystem

        public void setFromSystem(String fromSystem)
        Sets the name of the source system. For message queues, the source system is Admin.
        Parameters:
        fromSystem - Name of the source system.

      • setRowidAuditPrevious

        public void setRowidAuditPrevious(String rowidAuditPrevious)
        Sets the reference to ROWID_AUDIT of the related previous audit record. For example, a response audit record is linked to the corresponding request audit record.
        Parameters:
        rowidAuditPrevious - ROWID_AUDIT of the related previous audit record.

      • setContextXML

        public void setContextXML(String contextXML)
        Sets the absolute path and file name of the XML file that contains contextual information and metadata of the audited event or data. Use this method only for debugging and not in production environments because this method might affect the performance.
        Parameters:
        contextXML - Absolute path and file name of the XML file.
        See Also:
        setContext(String)

      • getDataXML

        public String getDataXML()
        Gets the absolute path and file name of the data XML file that is associated with the audited event.
        Returns:
        Absolute path and file name of the XML file.

      • setDataXML

        public void setDataXML(String dataXML)
        Sets the absolute path and file name of the data XML file that is associated with the audited event. For example, use an XML file that contains JMS messages. Use this method only for debugging and not in production environments because this method might affect the performance.

        Note: Passwords are not stored in the audit log. If a password exists in the XML stream, the MDM Hub replaces the password with asterisks (*).

        Parameters:
        dataXML - Absolute path and file name of the XML file.

      • getSystemName

        public String getSystemName()
        Gets the name of the system for which auditing is enabled.
        Specified by:
        getSystemName in interface SystemProvider
        Returns:
        Name of the system.
